info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 11:55PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Meagher. In southwest Montana, Broadwater. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, especially within and near the Woods Creek burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1153 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the Woods Creek burn scar. - Woods Creek burn area is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
